channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report E-2023090375
item.description:
Report E-2023090375

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: One 5 gallon pail was crushed due to being unsecured in transit, released 5 gallons in trailer.

item.title: Report E-2023090120
item.description:
Report E-2023090120

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced a UN2922 AB-73 release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of material released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the dock floor due to a pinhole puncture. The damaged pail was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Spill Fighter was then utilized to neutralize the impacted area. All impacted pads, cardboard, and cleanup debris were containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090299
item.description:
Report E-2023090299

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced a 2-pint release of UN1993 “Unisol Liquid Red BK-50” that was released from a 250-gallon metal tote containing residual material. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed a 2-pint release of material from a 250-gallon metal tote impacting a 2’ x 2’ area on the tote and a few drops on the trailer. Contractors collected the released product and impacted pads and damaged tote lid into a 30-gallon and 55-gallon metal drums. The tote lid was successfully replaced for shipment on. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023081997
item.description:
Report X-2023081997

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: MESA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT IN THE PRELOAD OPERATION. WEARING THE APPROPRIATE PPE RESPONDER WENT TO THE LOCATION OF THE SPILL FOR CLEAN UP. PLACING THE LEAKER IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND UTILIZING THE DECION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. THE RESPONDER THEN RETURNED WITH THE PACKAGE/DEBRIS TO THE DAMAGE CAGE FOR FURTHER INSPECTION.

item.title: Report X-2023081153
item.description:
Report X-2023081153

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-12
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The jerrican was found on the floor between the 5&6 load areas sitting in a puddle of it's own liquid which damaged some of the shipping label and the manufacturer's container label as well as the OP-900. It appears that it toppled off the end of the conveyor belt and cracked because the tape on the closure was still intact and not damaged. When it was discovered, the container was placed in a hazmat bag and brought to the QA area for further investigation. DescribePack: It appears that there is a crack in the bottom welded seam DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When it was discovered, the container was placed in a hazmat bag and brought to the QA area for further investigation.

item.title: Report E-2023090167
item.description:
Report E-2023090167

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of camp fuel(un1268) had been damaged by a sharp object and that 2 of the inner metal one gallon cans had released 2 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023081610
item.description:
Report X-2023081610

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded and placed into a Hazardous bag/tote and brought to the damage cage for staging. Then transferred to the hazmat cage for recording. DescribePack: One cap seal has a small hole/ puncture slight. I noticed the original tape was still intact when being inspected. The bottles of alcohol have been packed incorrectly. The bottles were shipped upside down caused the caps to be the base during shipping. Approximately 3 cups have been leaked. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a Hazardous bag/tote.
